intro: Microstylis sororia, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, preferring moist soils and partial shade. Microstylis sororia has narrow, linear leaves that are often densely packed along the stem. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland habitats and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
